laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count: 5200 per cubic millimeter; hematocrit: 36.3%; platelet count: 476,000 per cubic millimeter.
Sodium: 135 mmol/L; Potassium: 4.3 mmol/L; Blood urea nitrogen: 7 mg/dL; Creatinine: 1.4 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine decreased from 1.4 mg/dL to 1.1 mg/dL; BUN decreased from 7 mg/dL to 3 mg/dL; Sodium levels changed from 135 mmol/L to 137 mmol/L and then to 132 mmol/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Sodium: 137 mmol/L; Potassium: 3.4 mmol/L; Blood urea nitrogen: 3 mg/dL; Creatinine: 1.1 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Sodium increased from 135 mmol/L to 137 mmol/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Sodium: 132 mmol/L; Potassium: 2.9 mmol/L; Blood urea nitrogen: 4 mg/dL; Creatinine: 0.9 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine decreased from 1.4 mg/dL to 0.9 mg/dL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Basal cortisol level: 2.5 μg/dL; stimulated cortisol level: rose up to 18.2 μg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Cortisol level increased from a baseline of 2.5 μg/dL to 18.2 μg/dL after administration of cosyntropin.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Gadolinium-enhancing mass (1.0 cm by 1.0 cm by 1.1 cm) at the base of the third ventricle.
